divs: sighting detailsi was out at a restaurant on main street in manayunk with some friends. two of the people i was with were standing just outside of the front windows of the restaurant talking when they noticed something in the sky. one of my friends started banging on the front glass of the restaurant to grab my attention and told me to come out side quickly. i missed the beginning of the "light show", but i will address their accounts right after i give my description of what i witnessed. when i got outside, i saw four glowing orange orbs in the night sky. they were pulsing\flickering and were similar in color and action to what a flame would be on a lit candle, but were completely spherical in shape. the formation that they were in was in two separate pairs of two. moments after getting outside, the forth orb shrank in size and simply disappeared. of the three that were left, two still stayed relatively close to each other while the third stayed a bit off to the side. the two that were close together were moving steadily and slowly away from each other, then closer, then away, then closer and on and on like this for approximately two minutes. the distance that they moved away and closer to each other was exactly the same every time, it was not random by any means. just after this the third orb shrank in size until merely disappearing like the forth. the two that were left stayed equal distance from each other and simply just sat in the sky for a few more minutes. while this was happening other people in the street were also watching and some were coming over to us and saying, "oh my god, do you see that? ...what the hell could that be?" and other comments of the sort. then what happened to the forth and the third orb happened with the second. it shrank in size and disappeared. the about a minute later the same happened with the last orb and they were all gone. i tried to take a few pictures with my cell phone but there was too much ambient light from the restaurants, shops and streetlights. nothing showed up. after it was done, still more people were approaching us with the same response, "...oh my god did you see that?", "that was awesome!", ...oh my god, what the hell was that?". the accounts of my two friends that were outside first, said that when they first saw the sight the orbs they seemed to be "dancing with each other". they said that they were still divided in two groups of two. each pair was following a criss-cross flight pattern of their own; they were not synchronized with the other pair. they also said that when they first saw the orbs that they appeared to be at a lower altitude then when i was outside because they were larger in size. they said that as they were "dancing", all four were moving away at the same slow and steady speed until the altitude that they rested at when i stepped outside. my one friend said that when he first saw it, he thought that someone let something into the sky that might have had a flame attached. he said that it was when the "dancing" started, that he knew that it was definitely something else. he said that with the flight pattern that they were demonstrating that there was no way it was just an object floating through the wind. he said it was too precise and beyond anything "normal" that he could imagine. i am a skeptical person by nature; however, my personal belief regarding extraterrestrial life is that we would be small-minding to think that we are the only beings in existence. all i know is that what i was looking at was certainly not a plane, nor a helicopter. i would say that the size of the orb when i saw it was approx. three times the size of the north star. i would have to say i was excited to witness the phenomenon for the mere potential that it could be a once in a life time sighting, whatever it may be.
